verse.name: v1
verse.lines: {lang-eng}“Abba, Father,” we approach Thee In our Savior’s precious name. We, Thy children, here assembling, Now the promised blessing claim. From our guilt His blood has washed us, ’Tis through Him our souls draw nigh, And Thy Spirit too has taught us “Abba, Father,” thus to cry.{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v2
v3
verse.lines: {lang-eng}Clothed in garments of salvation At Thy table is our place We rejoice, and Thou rejoiced In the riches of Thy grace: “It is meet,” we hear Thee saying, “We should merry be and glad; I have found My once-lost children, Now they live who once were dead.”{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: {lang-eng}“Abba, Father,” we adore Thee, While the hosts in heaven above E’en in us now learn the wonders Of Thy wisdom, grace, and love. Soon before Thy throne assembled, All Thy children shall proclaim Abba’s love shown in redemption, And how full is Abba’s name!{/lang-eng}
